author: Special Correspondent
text:
Communist Party of India- Marxist (CPI-M), Puducherry unit on Wednesday demanded a white paper from the ruling All India NR Congress (AINRC) Government on the alleged backdoor recruitment and diversion of funds from provident fund of government employees for distribution of freebies.

In a statement, CPI-M unit secretary R.Rajangam said in last five years, AINRC failed to fulfil its promises made during last polls and failed to meet the aspirations of the people who underwent hardship during the Congress regime. The AINRC did not implement any welfare programme to raise the living standards of the people, he added.

“The ruling party is indulging in political gimmicks in laying foundation stones, inaugurations, distribution of welfare assistances in haste. The present government has been indulging in gimmicks which were similar to that of erstwhile Congress regime did in the fear of defeat ahead of last Assembly polls” said Mr. Rajangam.

In another statement, Mr. Rajangam also warned of agitation against the government if it fails to extend preference to the sportspersons in government employment.
title: CPI (M) demands White Paper on diversion of funds from PF
